solution_line_template: Jerry had {total_candy_pieces} pieces of candy / {total_bags} bags = <<{total_candy_pieces}/{total_bags}={candy_per_bag}>>{candy_per_bag} pieces of candy per bag.
There were chocolate hearts in {chocolate_heart_bags} bags * {candy_per_bag} = <<{chocolate_heart_bags}*{candy_per_bag}={chocolate_hearts_candy}>>{chocolate_hearts_candy} chocolate hearts.
There were chocolate kisses in {chocolate_kisses_bags} bags * {candy_per_bag} = <<{chocolate_kisses_bags}*{candy_per_bag}={chocolate_kisses_candy}>>{chocolate_kisses_candy} chocolate kisses.

There was a total of {chocolate_kisses_candy} + {chocolate_hearts_candy} chocolate candy = <<{chocolate_kisses_candy}+{chocolate_hearts_candy}={total_chocolate_candy}>>{total_chocolate_candy} chocolate.

Jerry started with {total_candy_pieces} pieces - {total_chocolate_candy} chocolate = <<{total_candy_pieces}-{total_chocolate_candy}={non_chocolate_candy}>>{non_chocolate_candy} pieces of non-chocolate candy.
